intro: Goniothalamus magnificus, commonly known as the magnificent goniothalamus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by round, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
